definition[0]: to stop opposing someone or something that is stronger than you, and allow them to take control
example[0]: Succumbing to pressure from the chemical industry, Governor Blakely amended the regulations.
example[1]: Gina succumbed to temptation and had a second serving of cake.
definition[1]: if you succumb to an illness, you become very ill or die of it
example[2]: About 400,000 Americans succumb each year to smoking-related illnesses.
